title: Thunderbird is already running, but is not responding. To use Thunderbird, you must first close the existing Thunderbird process, restart your device, or use a different profile.
content:
when clicking an email link this is shown

"Thunderbird is already running, but is not responding. To use Thunderbird, you must first close the existing Thunderbird process, restart your device, or use a different profile."

How do I make Thunderbird instead open a new email?

This is on Fedora
creator: theking2

title: Shared emails downloaded to Thunderbird from mail.twc.com
content:
My husband and I share an email account from TWC. The original account was weav13@roadrunner.com and then I added Weaver12@roadrunner.com. Recently we were unable to send emails from my Weaver12@roadrunner.com. I went into settings and changed the Default to my Weaver12@roadrunner.com and was able to send emails. Then his email did not work. How do I fix the settings to work for both of us. Also, at the same time I quit getting emails sent to my iphone. I have contacted Spectrum who administers our account and my server is mail.twc.com. I have tried many setting changes to fix this, as well as, searching on this site. The incoming email settings are POP. I have seen the Port should be 993 or 995. Not certain which is correct, but have tried both. The outgoing email settings are attached. How do I fix this? Also, how do I get emails on my iphone? Hope someone can help! Thank you.

Brenda Weaver
creator: brendaweaver1620

title: Thunderbird Supernova and my Windows 11 problems...
content:
My Thunderbird(115.8.0) and Windows 11 just don't get along. My Thunderbird has a Menu button in the top right that's just there for it does nothing when I click or right click so I guess no add-ons, calendar, etc. If I hover over it I see "Display the Thunderbird Menu" and that's it. When I open the program it doesn't go to my inbox, it goes to a page that I have to click on "Read Messages" to get to my inbox and in prior versions and I had Windows 10 this never happened. When I go to buttons on the left and click on "Help" and then "About Thunderbird" to check on updates I always get "Unable to check for updates due to internal error" and oh yeah now in Thunderbird I can't copy and paste, I can highlight but when I right click....nothing.

I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling and even tried removing hidden folders, but as of now nothing has worked. I don't know what to think and I'm truly at a loss and it sure looks like I have to find another email program because right now Thunderbird just ain't working. I've been using this program I believe for over 20 years with really zero problems but my luck has apparently run out. Sorry for the mini series. lol
creator: dmcgoo33

title: attach name body email
content:
Hi,

When I sent an email, I use this addon "#tbkeys" to add the file name of the attachment in the body email. Is there a way to automatically add the name of the attachment, without using a shortcut ?

and this is the code for shortcut key...

  1. tbkeys

{"ctrl+3": "(function () { var bucket = window.document.getElementById('attachmentBucket'); var names = []; for (var i = 0; i < bucket.getRowCount(); i++) names.push('• '+bucket.getItemAtIndex(i).getAttribute('name')); window.goDoCommandParams('cmd_smiley','This is Attachement name :

'+ names.join('
')); })();"}

title: Thunderbird creating Archives folder
content:
Currently on: 

 version: 115.8.0

Reference: Gmail account of mine.

Long back I had a folder called "Archives" which I had created to archive mails when I press the "a" button shortcut on Mozilla Thunderbird. After some time, I wanted to move the Archives folder to the "gmail/All Mail" folder. I changed the settings for that Imap account under "copies and folder" to point Message Archives section to "All Mail on <email>" folder under the "Other" radiobutton

But I see that every time I archive an incoming message, I see that the "Archives" folder is auto-created. Gmail by default puts all the emails into the "All Mail" (aka Archives) folder but I see another Label called "Archives" created by Thudnerbird.

I have skimmed through all my email filters and i am sure that there is no such filter which could create that label in Gmail.

If some more information is needed please get back to me and I can provide the same. Why does Thunderbird create that folder ? How and where do I stop it from doing so ?
creator: bhaslinux

title: Thunderbird sorting - how to by Sender & then Subject?
content:
I want to purge many years of "your package is on the way" spam. I don't know how to sort on two factors - first sender (amazon) and then the wording of the Subject. I want to keep the order confirmation and delivery confirmations.

Using TB 60.9.1, so if it becomes easy in a later rev let me know; I'd like to reduce the size of my files before upgrading to reduce the chance of glitches, but it if becomes simple...

Why do they spam you every few hours... Well, psychologically it keeps you thinking of that seller and supposedly likelier to buy something sooner...

title: Cannot change events that are created on Synology Calendar
content:
Hi,

I am running Thunderbird 115.6.0 on Linux.

One of my calendars is on a Synology NAS with Synology Calendar.

I can create new events. As long as I don't close Thunderbird I can change the events as well.

But after a restart of Thunderbird I cannot change the events anymore. Ending up with a o/rjcpdo/pdo/faa15765-29e1-4470-80d7-5157b042bddf.1705244573723.ics [HTTP/2 405 Method Not Allowed 817ms].

I can still change the event for instance on the default calendar of Android. The changed events also show up in Thunderbird.

After changing the event on Android. I can change the event in Thunderbird again untill restart.

What I've seen so far is that the working link from Thunderbird is different than the link when it is not working. Not working. https://XXXX.synology.me:80/caldav/xxxxx/rjcpdo/pdo/faa15765-29e1-4470-80xx-5157b042bddf.1705244573723.ics

working: https://XXXX.synology.me:80/caldav/xxxxx/rjcpdo/faa15765-29e1-4470-80xx-5157b042bddf.1705244573723.ics

I've changed part of the link (xxxx) but it is the extra pdo part in the not working link.

Anybody any idea what is going wrong here?

Regards
creator: janio2

title: email
content: For about the last month I have been having problems receiving emails via Thunderbird. Previously all was fine. The emails are with the the Sky/Yahoo email service in UK. The error message is of the form 'Login to server imap.mail.yahoo.com with username xxxxxxxsky.com failed' and is time dependent, i.e. is most likely to occur In the afternoon or evening (UK time - GMT) probably on a weekday. The same occurs when accessing the Sky email server. If I use Outlook to look at the Sky emails all is fine, so I could swap to Outlook but I really want to stick with Thunderbird. Emails from other email services work fine when accessed via Thunderbird. It cannot be a password problem because the error is time dependent. Please help.
creator: christopher-allen1

title: Partial disappearance of email account
content:
I have 2 email accounts, one Hotmail and a Gmail, in that order. On starting Thunderbird, I’m asked to put my Hotmail password in. It then works for a while then ask for password again. The Gmail one works fine. This has been going on for about 2 months.

In account settings it shows my_email@hotmail.com In Server settings: Server name: pop-mail.outlook.com User Name: my_email@hotmail.com

So far, all appears to be good. Where it fails is when I go to Tools>Settings>Passwords>Saved Passwords, no Hotmail account shows, only my Gmail account. Anyone have an idea how to solve the constant sign in and retrieve my account in Saved Passwords please?

Best regards,
creator: g0tch

title: thunderbird will not connect to btmail
content: Thunderbird will not connect to my bt mail. I have tried Mailbird, Outlook and others and they will not connect. I have checked configuration with BT and they say all OK. Have changed password - no change. Manually configured with password - no change. My PC has had a new SSD since and still will not connect. I have Broadband with BT so I get the same privaligies as Premium. I have malwarebytes and that allows them to connect. Up until a couple of weeks ago it worked OK and then suddenly it stopped working. Had my local Techie shop look at it - no result. They said it must be BT, but spoke to them again today and they say it should work - certainly with outlook. They recognise connection, but says either config or password incorrect. Changed password again, but no change. Can you please tell me where the problems is. Thanks
creator: r.symms

title: ztráta účtů
content: tučněDobrý den, už jsem tu dotaz vznesl a přišla mi odpověď: Zapnite si "Panel priečinkov" Moc děkuji, ale nešlo by to trochu popsat kde a jak to zapnu? Nikde se mi nepodařilo to najít. Pro informaci znovu popisuji problém, protože nejsem programátor, ale zedník a asi neumím správně hledat a proto jsem nenašel ani předchozí dotaz. Budu rád když mi někdo odpoví tak nějak polopaticky. Problém jedna: zmizely mi účty (asi ten panel prečinků) obrázek sken 1 Problém dva: dám vyhledat nějaký e-mail (sken 2) a sice najde vše, ale když chci konkrétní e-mail otevřít zůstane to prázdné (sken 3). Moc prosím o opravdu podrobnou radu. Pokud budu vědět konkrétní postup to dohledám, ale opravdu zapnout panel přečínků jen tak neumím. Děkuji a přeji hezký den.
